title: Citi Presents the 2012 Andras Felkai Academic Awards in Hungary
summary: Budapest, Hungary - Five talented university graduate professionals received the 2012 Andras Felkai Academic Award in an award ceremony in Budapest on August 28, 2012. The awards were presented by Batara Sianturi, Citi Country Officer for Hungary, and Tamas Felkai, representing the Andras Felkai Foundation.
tag-1: Citi Presents the 2012 Andras Felkai Academic Awards in Hungary
tag-2: Budapest, Hungary – Five talented university graduate professionals received the 2012 Andras Felkai Academic Award in an award ceremony in Budapest on August 28, 2012. The awards were presented by Batara Sianturi, Citi Country Officer for Hungary, and Tamas Felkai, representing the Andras Felkai Foundation.
tag-3: Zita Banyai, Tamas Erdos and Andras Tamas Takacs, who graduated from the Budapest University of Technology and Economics, and Julia Molnar and Zoltan Monostori, from the Corvinus University of Budapest, will use their prize money to sponsor their postgraduate studies in the fields of economics and finance. Since its establishment, the Andras Felkai Academic Award Fund has supported 28 young professionals in their postgraduate studies.
tag-4: Julia Molnar, one of this year's award winners, said: "An increasing number of university students and graduates participate every year in this program. I will use the funds to sponsor my CFA Level I exam, the first of three exams which must be completed to obtain the Chartered Financial Analyst designation. I believe that the CFA qualification will certainly help me to enhance my career opportunities and perspectives as it is considered the gold standard of professionalism and ethical behavior in the financial and investment communities."
tag-5: Batara Sianturi, Citi Country Officer for Hungary, said: "This is an important program for us. By supporting postgraduate studies of talented university students we are also able to contribute to the enrichment of the Hungarian economic and financial sector with highly qualified professionals who display personal qualities similar to those of Andras Felkai, including his open-minded, positive attitude, competence, leadership and international outlook."
tag-6: The Andras Felkai Academic Award was established in March 2002 as a tribute to Andras Felkai, a highly trained professional and a prominent and respected member of the Hungarian financial sector, who passed away in a tragic accident. Citibank Hungary, the family of Andras Felkai, several financial institutions and individual donors have contributed to the fund. The funds are currently managed by the Andras Felkai Foundation, a nonprofit organization established by the Felkai family in 2012.
tag-7: The annual award, which is paid from the interest of the fund, supports the studies of talented students and young professionals selected by the Judging Committee from the applicants based on developed evaluation criteria.
